means: [男子名] 克劳迪厄斯 Claude的变体

sentence.Network_en: The third century AD, ancient Rome, there was a tyrant called Clausius Meadows ( Claudius ).
sentence.Network_cn: 公元三世纪时, 古罗马有一位暴君叫克劳多斯 ( Claudius ).

sentence.Network_en: Claudius always doubted what he heard from his men.
sentence.Network_cn: 克劳迪斯总是怀疑从他的手下那边听来的消息.

sentence.Network_en: In 2000, John Updike published his 19 th novel, Gertrude and Claudius.
sentence.Network_cn: 2000年, 约翰·厄普代克出版了风格迥异的个人第19部小说《葛特露和克劳狄斯》.

means.word_mean: 1. Roman Emperor after his nephew Caligula was murdered; consolidated the Empire and conquered southern Britain; was poisoned by his fourth wife Agrippina after her son Nero was named as Claudius' heir (10 BC to AD 54)
